intro: Impatiens fargesii, commonly known as the Yunnan impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of pink, white, and red. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural habitat.
